text: hello and welcome to BBC World News we
begin with breaking news this hour
Pakistan says it has shot down two
Indian aircraft which it claims were
over Pakistani airspace the Pakistani
military also says its warplanes carried
out airstrikes inside India India says
the Pakistani Jets were forced to
retreat by its own aircraft but has not
confirmed whether any of its planes were
shot down or details are still emerging
but a spokesman for the Pakistani Armed
Forces major general acid Kapoor has
tweeted this he says that in response to
Pakistan Air Force strikes the Indian
Air Force crossed the line of control
the LOC in Kashmir he goes on to say
that Pakistan shot down two Indian
aircraft inside Pakistani airspace one
of the aircraft fell on Pakistan
controlled Kashmir that's written here
as a J and K and the other fell inside
IOC that's how Pakistan refers to
indian-controlled Kashmir he finishes by
saying that one Indian pilot was
arrested by Pakistani troops on the

scan from Islamabad I'm joined by
secundo Kimani let's go to secunda
Kimani first welcome to you tell us
exactly what we know has happened and
what we're hearing from the military
secunda so I've just come out of a
briefing a press conference by the
Pakistani military the Pakistani
military spokesman broke down
the chronology of these dramatic events
that took place today according to him
this began when Pakistani jets from
within Pakistani airspace targeted
Indian positions within India across the
border as a response to those strikes he
says that Indian Jets crossed over into

shot down to Indian jets as a result of

forces the Pakistani military said that
is not true now I asked the Pakistani
military spokesman if the
these actions by Pakistan in targeting
in carrying out these strikes across the
border in India were pushing the two

they weren't he said that Pakistan had
acted responsibly and he said Pakistan
had deliberately chosen not to hit
Indian military targets or areas where

ground just across the border in India
and he said that the Pakistani military
did this because they wanted to act in

certainly though these are developments
will cause huge concern amongst the

region that's the explanation from
Islamabad let's go to thank you to

officials here in Delhi have yet to
issue a response
the only person we've heard from is
Sushma Swaraj now she is India's foreign

reiterating really what has been a

from both sides saying they're not
looking for an escalation in tensions
but secunda just explained the
chronology over the past few weeks of
well how we've got to this point that's

ago when a militant group carried out a

base in Pakistan and has according to a

authorities to blame
not just this Pakistani militant group
but effectively the Pakistani state for
being involved in this attack which led

as a result yesterday Indian the Indian

airspace and carried out some attacks
they said they targeted a base of this

number of militants eyewitnesses on the

a few civilian houses were damaged one

claiming this response from Pakistan
that we've seen today is is really the

some sort of context India's incursion
into Pakistani airspace was the first of
its kind since 1971 which just shows the
kind of serious consideration that the
Indian authorities have been given
giving their response to that terror
atrocity that Secunda was just referring
to there this incursion of airspace is
something that is really very unusual
what you usually see is a lap is along
the line of control which is effectively
the de facto border now in Kashmir
between India and Pakistan military
exchanges between the two they don't
happen often but they certainly do
happen with some regularity we saw those
kicking off once more
last night but what I would say is that
this mutual exchange by which both sides
have infringed each other's airspace is
certainly a significant rise in tensions
between those two countries Secunda how
it had been seeing there in terms of
whether or not this is as
crucial kind of breaking point for the

within Pakistan recognizes that this is
now a very very serious situation let's
not forget these are two countries that

there's a pressure really I think on

the feeling that they needed to to do

that's what we've seen today so it's not
really clear where exactly this will end
I think the fact that there are two

now very significant the Pakistani

and it's not clear yet whether the

India as a result might act with more

Pakistani custody thank you - final

going back all the way to 1947 why is
Kashmir this disputed territory why is
it so important to both countries just
quickly before I do that just to pick up
on secundus point we've now had the
international community reacting to what
has been going on so we've now had the
European Union and the United States
calling for a de-escalation on both
sides and I think it's going to be
important to watch what that
international reaction is throughout the
day but just to go back there have been
tensions between India and Pakistan
unfolding over Kashmir since 1947 when
the British divided the subcontinent
into India and Pakistan Kashmir was
taken into the sovereign territory of
India at that point it was a Muslim
majority state as it is now but with a
Hindu King this made it typical of only
two states in the newly formed India
ever since that has happened Pakistan
has disputed that the population there
wants to be Indian they have
consistently claimed that they would
rather have joined Pakistan India since
that point has as Secunda said fought
three wars with Pakistan over Kashmir
and who should have final control of it
in the 1990s the United Nations
intervened and formed what's called the
line of control and what it did in
effect was split Kashmir and to give the
Pakistanis half of it to administer
that's the northern part and then the
southern part was given to India to
administer that line of control samantha
is an effect a de facto border between
India and Pakistan so when we see
tensions rising as they have done since
it is usually along that line and that's
exactly what we're seeing now so this
infringement of airspace has happened
just around that line of control that de
